name: Honda
summary:
Honda offers 5 car models in India, including 1 car in SUV category, 4 cars in Sedan category. Honda has 2 upcoming cars in India, WR-V and 0 Alpha.

Start of operations in India:
Honda, a Japanese automobile manufacturer, entered the Indian market in 1996. They set up a manufacturing facility in Greater Noida, Uttar Pradesh and introduced a range of models for different segments. The Honda City sedan was their inaugural model and has been available in India for over two decades now. 

Market Share:
Honda cars has a market share of 2.5 per cent in India, with a particularly strong presence in the mid-size sedan and compact SUV segments. The brand has a loyal customer base, thanks to its reputation for quality and performance. It sells sedans and SUVs. 

Key Aspects: 
Honda car's USP in India lies in its focus on engineering excellence, reliability, and fuel efficiency. The brand is known for producing cars that offer a smooth and comfortable driving experience, making them suitable for both urban and long-distance travel. 

Competitors: 
The Indian automotive market is highly competitive, and Honda competes by emphasizing its product quality and performance. Major competitors include Maruti Suzuki, Hyundai, Toyota, Tata Motors, Kia, and Mahindra.
Honda Cars Price List (November 2025) in India
Honda car price starts at Rs 7.01 Lakh for the cheapest model which is Amaze 2nd Gen and the price of most expensive model, which is City Hybrid eHEV starts at Rs 19.53 Lakh. The prices for the top 5 popular Honda Cars are: Honda Elevate Price is Rs. 11.05 Lakh, Honda Amaze Price is Rs. 7.45 Lakh, Honda City Price is Rs. 12.00 Lakh, Honda Amaze 2nd Gen Price is Rs. 7.01 Lakh and Honda City Hybrid eHEV Price is Rs. 19.53 Lakh.

faqs.question: Q: What are the upcoming cars from Honda?
faqs.answer: Honda is expected to launch Honda WR-V and Honda 0 Alpha in the coming months.

faqs.answer: The cheapest Honda car in India is Amaze 2nd Gen, priced at Rs. 7.01 Lakh.

faqs.question: Q: Which is the most expensive Honda car in India?
faqs.answer: The most expensive Honda car in India is City Hybrid eHEV, priced at Rs. 19.53 Lakh.

faqs.answer: The latest car launched by Honda is Amaze on 04 Dec 2024.

faqs.answer: The most popular Honda cars in India are Elevate (Rs. 11.05 Lakh), Amaze (Rs. 7.45 Lakh) and City (Rs. 12.00 Lakh).

name: Maruti Suzuki
summary:
Maruti car price starts at Rs 3.50 Lakh for the cheapest model which is S-Presso and the price of most expensive model, which is Invicto starts at Rs 24.97 Lakh. Maruti offers 18 car models in India, including 5 cars in SUV category, 2 cars in Sedan category, 7 cars in Hatchback category, 3 cars in MUV/MPV category, 1 car in Minivan category. Maruti has 3 upcoming cars in India, e Vitara, Grand Vitara and Wagon R.
Maruti Suzuki has been the biggest carmaker in India for decades. In fact, one in every four cars sold every month is a Maruti Suzuki. With 18 models on sale today, all Maruti Suzuki cars are widely known for their affordability and fuel-efficient powertrains. Adding to Maruti’s popularity is the highest number of showrooms and service centres across the country with easy availability of spare parts. For numbers, there are 4,564 touch points across 2,304 cities in India. Maruti operates under two types of dealerships which include Maruti Nexa cars and Maruti Arena cars. Maruti Suzuki sells its premium cars under the Nexa outlet.

One aspect in which Maruti Suzuki has remained unbeaten is fuel efficiency. Their powertrains are also shared across the model range making them easy to source for parts. Apart from light-on-pocket CNG options, Maruti has now started offering strong hybrid powertrains along with their mild-hybrid powertrains as well. Although there is no diesel option anymore, all petrol engines offered by Maruti Suzuki are RDE compliant. Maruti is also working heavily towards flex fuel compatibility for their future models. Once known for bare-basic cabins and lack of features, Maruti Suzuki’s new line-up offers everything you could ask for in terms of features and equipment.
Maruti Suzuki Cars Price List (November 2025) in India
Maruti Suzuki car price starts at Rs. 3.50 Lakh and goes upto Rs. 10.50 Lakh (Avg. ex-showroom). The prices for the top 5 popular Maruti Suzuki Cars are: Maruti Suzuki Victoris Price is Rs. 10.50 Lakh, Maruti Suzuki Swift Price is Rs. 5.79 Lakh, Maruti Suzuki Dzire Price is Rs. 6.26 Lakh, Maruti Suzuki Brezza Price is Rs. 8.26 Lakh and Maruti Suzuki Wagon R Price is Rs. 4.99 Lakh.

faqs.question: Q: What are the upcoming cars from Maruti Suzuki?
faqs.answer: Maruti Suzuki is expected to launch Maruti Suzuki e Vitara in the next 2 months while Maruti Suzuki Grand Vitara and Maruti Suzuki Wagon R are lined up for later.

faqs.answer: The cheapest Maruti Suzuki car in India is S-Presso, priced at Rs. 3.50 Lakh.

faqs.question: Q: Which is the most expensive Maruti Suzuki car in India?
faqs.answer: The most expensive Maruti Suzuki car in India is Invicto, priced at Rs. 24.97 Lakh.

faqs.question: Q: Which is the latest car launched by Maruti Suzuki?
faqs.answer: The latest car launched by Maruti Suzuki is Victoris on 15 Sep 2025.

faqs.question: Q: Which are the most popular Maruti Suzuki cars in India?
faqs.answer: The most popular Maruti Suzuki cars in India are Victoris (Rs. 10.50 Lakh), Fronx (Rs. 6.85 Lakh) and Swift (Rs. 5.79 Lakh).

name: Tata
summary:
Tata car price starts at Rs 4.57 Lakh for the cheapest model which is Tiago and the price of most expensive model, which is Harrier EV starts at Rs 21.49 Lakh. Tata offers 15 car models in India, including 9 cars in SUV category, 2 cars in Sedan category, 4 cars in Hatchback category. Tata has 6 upcoming cars in India, Sierra, Sierra EV, Punch Facelift, Safari EV, Altroz EV and Avinya.
Tata Motors has a diverse portfolio of vehicles, including commercial vehicles, passenger cars, and even EVs. The brand is present in varied segments, body styles, and price points and caters to different needs of customers. After selling the Indica/Indigo range and the Safari for the majority of the first two decades in the 21st century, Tata has come a long way in delivering world-class products, as is evident with cars like the Harrier, the new Safari and the Nexon.

Tata vehicles are known for their rated safety, stylish design, spacious and comfortable cabin, diesel and EV powertrains, and lastly, for the amount of new features they provide. Tata’s strong commitment to safety has resulted in their cars proving their crashworthiness, having scored high in GNCAP crash tests. Going ahead, the company’s focus is on improving the end-user experience, with all the frequent updates when it comes to in-car technology and interior appointments. More importantly, Tata has also invested heavily in EV motoring and is currently the leading brand when it comes to sales of EVs in India.

name: Hyundai
summary:
Hyundai offers 14 car models in India, including 9 cars in SUV category, 2 cars in Sedan category, 3 cars in Hatchback category. Hyundai has 9 upcoming cars in India, Ioniq 5 Facelift, 2026 Verna, Palisade, Ioniq 9, Tucson Facelift, Staria, Stargazer, New Santa Fe and Ioniq 6.

Start of operations in India:
Hyundai Motor India Limited, a subsidiary of South Korean automaker Hyundai Motor Company, entered India in 1996 and opened its innings with the successful launch of the Hyundai Santro in 1998. Since then, it has grown its product portfolio across various body styles and has emerged as one of the top five car manufacturers in India.  

Market share: 
Hyundai has a significant market share in India's automotive industry, holding the position as the second-largest carmaker in the country with a 15 per cent market share. It sells hatchbacks, sedans, SUVs, and EVs.

Key Aspects:
Hyundai is renowned in India for its reliable, feature-rich, and stylish vehicles at competitive prices. The brand's strength lies in offering innovative features, modern design, and a wide range of choices to suit diverse customer preferences.

Competitors: 
In India, Hyundai faces competition from various car manufacturers, including Maruti Suzuki, Tata, Honda, Mahindra, MG, Renault, Nissan, Toyota, and Kia.  

Services Offered:
Hyundai Subscription offers a flexible and affordable way to drive a brand-new car without ownership. With zero down payment and road tax, customers can choose their desired car, opt for monthly or yearly subscriptions, and keep it for up to 48 months. After a 12-month lock-in period, subscribers can opt-out anytime, or choose to buy the car at a pre-determined settlement value. 
Hyundai Cars Price List (November 2025) in India
Hyundai car price starts at Rs 5.47 Lakh for the cheapest model which is Grand i10 Nios and the price of most expensive model, which is Ioniq 5 starts at Rs 46.30 Lakh. The prices for the top 5 popular Hyundai Cars are: Hyundai Venue Price is Rs. 7.90 Lakh, Hyundai Venue N Line Price is Rs. 10.55 Lakh, Hyundai Creta Price is Rs. 10.73 Lakh, Hyundai Exter Price is Rs. 5.68 Lakh and Hyundai Grand i10 Nios Price is Rs. 5.47 Lakh.

faqs.answer: Hyundai is expected to launch Hyundai Ioniq 5 Facelift, Hyundai 2026 Verna and Hyundai Palisade in the coming months.

name: Kia
summary:
Kia offers 9 car models in India, including 5 cars in SUV category, 4 cars in MUV/MPV category. Kia has 5 upcoming cars in India, New Seltos, EV3, Tasman, Syros EV and EV5.

Start of operations in India:
Kia Motors, a South Korean automobile manufacturer, entered the Indian market in 2019. The brand is a subsidiary of Hyundai Motor Company and has quickly gained popularity in the country.

Market Share: 
Kia cars has a market share of 7 per cent in India. The brand has established a formidable presence across various segments, challenging well-established players in the Indian automotive market. It currently sells SUVs, MPVs, and BEVs.

Key Aspects:
Kia stands out by offering Indian consumers well-designed, feature-packed, and affordable cars. The brand provides a premium experience with modern features, appealing to customers seeking high-quality vehicles at an affordable price.

Competitors: 
Kia faces major competition in India from other well-known automobile manufacturers. The main rivals of Kia are Hyundai, Maruti Suzuki, Toyota, MG, Skoda, Volkswagen, Nissan, Renault, and Citroen.

Services Offered: 
Kia's UVO (Your Voice) is an advanced connected car technology which offers features like remote control, vehicle tracking, and emergency assistance. Through the UVO app, Kia owners can interact with their cars using smartphones, enhancing convenience and safety.

Kia car price starts at Rs 7.30 Lakh for the cheapest model which is Sonet and the price of most expensive model, which is EV9 starts at Rs 1.30 Crore. name: Mahindra
summary:
Mahindra car price starts at Rs 7.28 Lakh for the cheapest model which is XUV 3XO and the price of most expensive model, which is XEV 9e starts at Rs 21.90 Lakh. Mahindra offers 13 car models in India, including 11 cars in SUV category, 1 car in MUV/MPV category, 1 car in Coupe category. Mahindra has 14 upcoming cars in India, XEV 9S, XUV700 Facelift, Bolero 2026, Thar.e, Vision S Sub Compact SUV, Vision X Compact SUV, XUV 3XO EV, Global Pik Up, BE.07, Vision S Compact SUV, BE.09, Vision X Sub Compact SUV, Vision T and Vision SXT.
Mahindra has been regarded as a maker of dependable utility vehicles. It is well known for its Jeep-inspired range of vehicles, light commercial vehicles, and the iconic duo i.e. the Scorpio and the Bolero. In recent years, Mahindra has achieved exceptional popularity with its range of new-age vehicles including the XUV 700 and the Scorpio N.

Primarily known for its range of big and rugged SUVs, Mahindra has expanded its horizon to smaller vehicles, autonomous technology, and alternative fuels. The XUV300 compact SUV, the fully-loaded XUV700, and the all-electric XUV400 are the results of Mahindra’s growing avenues. It has also been successful in reviving iconic sub-brands like the Bolero and the Thar and brought them up to date with sophisticated powertrain options, higher-quality interiors, and improved space efficiency. Going forward, Mahindra is working on a range of fully electric vehicles based on dedicated EV platforms. Additionally, the brand is also working on a pick-up truck based on the Scorpio N.

name: Toyota
summary:
Toyota car price starts at Rs 6.39 Lakh for the cheapest model which is Glanza and the price of most expensive model, which is Land Cruiser starts at Rs 2.16 Crore. Toyota offers 12 car models in India, including 5 cars in SUV category, 1 car in Sedan category, 1 car in Hatchback category, 4 cars in MUV/MPV category, 1 car in Pickup category. Toyota has 4 upcoming cars in India, Urban Cruiser EV, Urban Cruiser Hyryder 7 seater, BZ4X and New Land Cruiser FJ.
Offering unmatched reliability, Toyota is now a synonym for cars that can effortlessly go thousands of kilometres without trouble. Toyota India’s two high-demand offerings – Innova and Fortuner enjoy a cult following in India. Internationally, Toyota is renowned for its hybrid powertrains which have been given a run in India as well. What started with Prius, continues with the Camry with the reputable hybrid powertrain. That’s not all; Toyota does cater to the affluent in India with their flagship products like the Land Cruiser and Vellfire. In fact, the Land Cruiser offers the most affordable service in the premium SUV segment. On the other hand, having proven its mettle across the globe, the trusty Hilux is also on sale in India.

Toyota is also at the forefront of motorsport across various genres. They have been dominating the endurance races as well as Dakar off-roading for many years now. Results of which are undoubtedly seen on their road cars. In 2019, Toyota and Suzuki entered into an agreement for models and technology sharing. The two Japanese giant’s joint collaboration is also seen in India with Toyota and Maruti Suzuki rebadged models.

Toyota car price starts at Rs. 6.39 Lakh and goes upto Rs. 2.16 Crore (Avg. ex-showroom). name: Nissan
summary:
Nissan car price starts at Rs 5.62 Lakh for the cheapest model which is Magnite and the price of most expensive model, which is X-Trail starts at Rs 48.20 Lakh. Nissan offers 2 car models in India, including 2 cars in SUV category. Nissan has 3 upcoming cars in India, New MPV, Tekton and Qashqai.
Nissan India is a subsidiary of Japanese automobile manufacturer Nissan Motor Company. The company made its debut in the country in 2005. The X-Trail was the first product to be launched by Nissan in India.

Currently, Nissan sells five products in India including the Micra, Sunny, Kicks, Terrano, and the GT-R. All these products are locally manufactured, with the only exception being the GT-R, which is a CBU. The company has an alliance with Renault and they have set up a production facility in Chennai. The brand also has a Research and Development (R&D) center in the same region.

Nissan is also said to be working on introducing the Leaf EV in India. The model has been showcased to numerous customers during private previews. The second-generation Nissan Leaf will be brought to India via the CBU route and is likely to remain similar to the international-spec model.

name: Volkswagen
summary:
Volkswagen car price starts at Rs 11.16 Lakh for the cheapest model which is Virtus and the price of most expensive model, which is Golf GTI starts at Rs 50.91 Lakh. Volkswagen offers 4 car models in India, including 2 cars in SUV category, 1 car in Sedan category, 1 car in Hatchback category. Volkswagen has 4 upcoming cars in India, Tayron, Tera SUV, Taigun Facelift and ID.4.
German automobile manufacturer Volkswagen entered the Indian market back in 2007. The parent company, Volkswagen Group India, is a fully owned subsidiary of Wolfsburg, Germany based brand, Volkswagen AG. 
Volkswagen India has its plant located in Chakan, Pune with a production capacity of 2 lakh units per annum. The company manufactures the Polo, Taigun and Vento at this plant. It also sells the Tiguan in India which is assembled at their SAVWIPL plant in Aurangabad alongside other models from the Volkswagen range.
Volkswagen also has a motorsport department in India known as the Volkswagen Motorsport India. Founded in 2009, it focuses on the One-make racing championship that is held at a national level every year. The championship series began with the Polo Cup, which was later changed to Vento Cup. Currently, the championship series is run as the Polo Cup.

name: Ferrari
summary:
errari car price starts at Rs 3.31 Crore for the cheapest model which is Portofino and the price of most expensive model, which is Purosangue SUV starts at Rs 9.93 Crore. Ferrari offers 6 car models in India, including 1 car in SUV category, 1 car in Convertible category, 4 cars in Coupe category.
Italian marquee Ferrari was founded back in 1939 by Enzo Ferrari. The company has its Headquarters in Maranello, Italy. Ferrari features the famous prancing horse logo finished in a shade of black with a yellow background on every model.

Ferrari has two dealers in India, located in Mumbai and New Delhi. The company has a wide range of products or cars to choose from, including the 812 Superfast, 812 GTS, SF90 Stradale, F8 Tributo, F8 Spider, 488 Pista, 488 Pista Spyder, GTC4Lusso, GTC4LussoT, Portofino, Monza SP1 and Monza SP2.

Scuderia Ferrari is the motorsport division of the Italian brand through which it competes in a range of categories such as Formula 1. The company also undertakes special projects and oneff-off model orders tailor-made to suit the demands and taste of the customer. The car maker has not revealed any plans for electrification as yet.
